p: The polarization of the LiFePO 4/C electrode is explained by the electron transfer pathway, as shown in Figure 8A. The carbon is dispersed unevenly, so the electrons cannot reach the entire reactive site where the Li + ions intercalate. In contrast, for LiFePO 4/graphene, due to the one-dimensional Li + ion mobility in the framework, the graphene can ensure that electrons reach particles from all directions and alleviate the polarization, as shown in Figure 8B. Therefore, the LiFePO 4/graphene composites, with well-defined peaks and smaller potential difference, have higher electrochemical reactivity.
